attributes.action: To be able to get a vehicle privately removed if it is deemed an obstruction
attributes.background: The laws on obstruction of someone's property is limited! If a vehicle is obstructing entrance to your property, be it drive way/carport or land, make it possible for you to get it privately towed without having to get the police involved!

attributes.action: Make the motor trade require a licence to be a mechanic
attributes.background: The motor trade unlike all other trades doesn't require a licence for the tradesmen and women to work. Garages can employ anybody as a mechanic. Unlike plumbers for example who need licences to work. A licence would ensure mechanics are capable of doing the job to a reasonable standard and safely.

attributes.action: Set up an online registry for living organ donation
attributes.background: I recently called my regional transplant centre to donate a kidney and found that the process of ringing and finding information about living donation daunting and difficult. An online living donor registry with a pre-screening process could help encourage others to come forward and also save time.
attributes.additional_details:
I was told that it was unlikely to be able to due to being a young female (risks of renal failure during future pregnancy). A online registry with sufficient information could therefore save time as the medical professional had to explain the reasoning to me whilst simultaneously ensuring only those eligible come forward. 
From my perspective, there isn't enough education and awareness surrounding this topic and promoting living donation more may significantly help the many people in need

attributes.action: Abolish the annual Rod Licence for anglers in England and Wales
attributes.background: More than a million freshwater anglers in England and Wales (not Scotland) pay an annual fee for a (fishing) Rod Licence. This is a tax on angling. Yet there is no licence needed to walk the same river, nor to visit our National Parks, nor to climb a mountain or bicycle on our roads.
attributes.additional_details: Income from licences is falling. Between 2010 and 2016 a drop of 12.6%. Income down from £25.4m to £22.2m. Dr. Broughton at the ATA has collated data over the last six years. •You don't need a licence in Scotland or for sea fishing. •It is unfair anglers have to buy a licence to enjoy a legal hobby when no others who make an equal claim on natural resources do •Anglers spend £1.2bn annually; that is £240m in VAT income alone. Abolition is likely to see participation increase

attributes.action: Introduce 19 baby check questions in to prenatal & postnatal information given
attributes.background: 19 baby check questions may help identify if a baby has Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS) risk. Should be included in prenatal & postnatal information from midwifes & health visitor. You are given leaflet about enviromental factors. Check List only available from charity which supports after SIDS.
attributes.additional_details: Studies show 19 question scored checklist may determine which babies are at risk of SIDS. It is based on many symptoms & signs that are not significant individually, but taken together may signify a risk of death. The Baby Check as a means of quantifying acute illness, can be used by parents to help them decide whether to seek medical attention. It can be used by health professionals as a tool to discriminate between those babies who should be assessed in hospital and those who need not be.

attributes.action: Protect civilian war graves from the World wars
attributes.background: Having recently discovered that some civlian war graves are being overfilled for re-use,  I believe these should be rewarded due respect as are Military graves.
attributes.additional_details: Graves have already been overfilled at New Southgate and City of London cemetery (see https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/may/06/re-using-graves-means-uk-cemetery-will-never-run-out-of-space), are currently been threatened at Camberwell Cemetery and shortly so at Manor park cemetery

attributes.action: Fund a campaign promoting hemp farming + the use of biodegradable hemp packaging
attributes.background: For those of you that don't know hemp farming in the UK is legal under licence, thus making hemp products legal, hemp plastic is 100% biodegradable, when exposed to the elements and has a long lasting in shop on shelf lifespan, normal plastic even when broken down never really goes away.
attributes.additional_details: Normal plastic when broken down to micro fragments often ends up in the ocean being eaten by krill and other sea creatures working it's way up the food chain, every year it's estimated we (humans) eat 11000 micro fragments of plastic every year coming from seafood, plastic is in our food chain this needs to change. We absorb fewer than 1% but they will still accumulate in the body over time Let's stop killing our oceans Hemp has an endless amount of uses Fuel building Materials, so much more.

attributes.action: Stop cyclists from using mobile phones and headphones whilst in motion.
attributes.background: As a cyclist myself, it irritates me when I see other bike riders giving the rest of us a bad reputation by using mobile phones or listening to music on headphones whilst in motion. And don't get me started on ignoring traffic lights! The rules of the road need to be enforced.

attributes.action: Ban video games that promote violence and sexual abuse.
attributes.background: I would like the UK Government to change the laws on video games which normalise gun violence, prostitution, rape etc. There are children as young as 7 playing these games online without their parents knowing. This is not something that should be acceptable, full stop.
attributes.additional_details: Why should these games showing guns, sex, prostitution, gangs and so on be available to children when violence, acid attacks, rape and murders are happening in our country?

attributes.action: Stop councils charging for DIY waste at recycling sites.
attributes.background: The relevant government department has stated that these charges should not be imposed. Any discouragement to the proper disposal of DIY waste will contribute to the increase in fly tipping.

attributes.action: Include the Welsh dragon onto the Union Jack.
attributes.background: For centuries Wales has been brutally ignored from our nation's flag. We with a voice must feel empowered to speak up against this disgrace. In November 2007 the House of Commons discussed this however no follow up action has been executed. We must take action and be proud of our heritage!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-25222891 Here is a fantastic list of examples of how the UK should represent the beautiful country of Wales. 
IMG_7543.JPG

attributes.action: Enforce a maximum limit on vehicle insurance prices for young people.
attributes.background: Insurance prices in this modern day are through the roof. And its even worse for young drivers. I know there is more of a chance of us crashing due to lack of experience however we still need to get to work and function as a part of society.
attributes.additional_details: My first year car insurance was £1600 on a Ford Ka. Paid in monthly instalments. Unfortunately I crashed in my first year due to a spillage on the road during a wet day. Unavoidable. I was following the speed limit, no one else was involved. But my insurance is due to rise to upwards of £3000 in January. I am 19 and well paid for my age but still this is going to be a struggle. I know many people who also struggle with this however first year drivers older than 24 pay less, how does that work?

attributes.action: Make Northumberland Scottish land
attributes.background: I think that Scotland should rightfully own Northumberland. This is because Northumberland and Scotland share a similar culture and have strong ethnic ties. I believe this may help with the economy and natural resources as Northumberland has a lot of coal.
attributes.additional_details: Back in 2014/2015 many petitions were made for Northumberland to once again join Scotland. Many news articles reported on this. However, the people who signed those petitions did not get their wish. We have a shared history and culture. The UK Government in London doesn't govern Northumberland very well.

attributes.action: Make access to food, clothes and shelter a human right, enshrined in law.
attributes.background: Poverty is a very real phenomonon for many in the UK today and the inequality gap between the rich and the poor continues to widen. Lets underline the boundaries of our civilisation. Too many people will sleep in the street this winter. Lets end homelessness and hunger in the UK, 1 meal at a time.
attributes.additional_details: I am a citizen, with a voice and a computer.  I just can't continue to pass the increasing number of people on the street and try to give them change for a cup of tea without recognising that the problem needs to be tackled strategically/politically.  I also worked as a health visitor and saw first hand how many families don,t have consistent access to meals.  The problem is huge and needs a strategic response at a national level.  Food, clothes and shelter for all is not too much to ask.

attributes.action: Re-open the Dubs scheme to allow unaccompanied child refugees entry into the UK
attributes.background: The Government announced in February that it would close the Dubs scheme – intended to grant 3000 vulnerable unaccompanied minors a safe passage to Britain – after accepting just 350. We are capable of taking thousands more. Sign to call for the scheme to be reopened & help these desperate children.
attributes.additional_details: FOI requests have shown that local councils have voluntarily offered to accept 1572 more children than are currently being supported, yet the Government is refusing to accept any more child refugees from the continent. The longer this goes on the more likely it is that children will go missing & fall into the hands of traffickers. Our values of openness & tolerance mean that we have a duty to be a land of sanctuary to these vulnerable children. The Government must act now and re-open the scheme.

attributes.action: Stop companies asking for payment details for free trials of services.
attributes.background: For Free trials of services companies request payment details for the said trials. Failure to terminate at the end of a trial would normal mean services are charged for the next billing period. They should provide a option to terminate at point of  registering for free trail or terminate at expiry
attributes.additional_details:
Netflix
Linked in 
NOW TV  and so many more
They are all are relying on some income from those that forget to terminate. A free trial in good faith would not require payment method. It should be illegal not to auto terminate or give the option to terminate at the point of registering

attributes.action: Make more council houses and flats
attributes.background: There are to many family's and single people suffering about not having homes we need to make sure that nobody should be homeless in this day and age families or people should feel safe
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken to people living on the streets also have seen to many programmes on this subject the government needs to take action

attributes.action: Increase pedestrian crossing times to enable disabled people to cross safely
attributes.background:
Often when I wait to cross the road and the green man appears, it goes off again whilst I'm only halfway through crossing - and I'm an able bodied person.

My father has MS and walks with a stick, meaning he and many other disabled people are not provided with enough time to safely cross the road.

attributes.action: Amend building regulations to ban use of wooden/ laminate flooring in flats.
attributes.background:
Wooden and laminate floors in non-ground floor flats can make life very difficult for people living in flats below. The noise can be unbearable. 

Building regulations should be amended to ban the use of such flooring in non-ground floor flats.

attributes.action: Reinstate the funding for the Underground Maths project.
attributes.background: The Underground Maths website was the best resource available for teachers of A level Maths. The DfE recently stopped its funding. The removal of the funding means that it will no longer be developed, and it has been left incomplete. A level mathematics teaching in the UK will be poorer for it.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information, see these links. The Smith report is a government report on mathematics teaching that specifically endorses the Underground Maths project.

https://undergroundmathematics.org/ 

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/exclusive-dfe-abandons-flagship-maths-programme

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smith-review-of-post-16-maths-report-and-government-response

attributes.action: Prescribe dance fitness classes on the NHS for everyone's good health
attributes.background: Classes like Zumba should be free and prescribed to everyone on the NHS as they provide multiple health benefits including losing weight and has been known to fight depression.

attributes.action: Introduce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia
attributes.background: The Saudi state is notorious for its unjust and frankly disgusting treatment of women and LGBT people. It also massively restricts the civil liberties of its entire population. There is also evidence that suggests Saudi donors sponsor terrorism. We cannot support governments of this sort.
attributes.additional_details:
From gov.uk: 
"It’s illegal for women to drive."
"Homosexual acts and extra-marital sexual relations, including adultery, are illegal and can be subject to severe penalties."
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge"

A series of leaks from the then-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's emails suggested that Saudi donors fund extremism.
A number of mosques found to be preaching extremist Wahhabism have been said to be linked to Saudi organisations.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time from 5 years to 3 for a divorce without consent.
attributes.background: You can divorce with their consent after 2 years separation but if they decide not to consent you then have to wait 5 years and you can divorce without their consent. 5 years is too long and more than double the 2 years with consent.

attributes.action: Debate whether Private finance initiative should be outlawed for local councils
attributes.background:
should there be a national debate whether Private finance initiative should be outlawed for local councils?
Prof Allyson Pollock, said “are consistently higher than public borrowing costs”. 
Barts Health NHS Trust will pay £7 billion for a hospital which cost £1.1 billion
attributes.additional_details:
Barts Health rebuild cost £1.1 billion but, the final cost will be more than £7 billion with the Barts Health NHS Trust making payments until 2049. 
PFI deals will cost taxpayers £209bn over next 35 years.

attributes.action: Cut the "Aid budget" to other countries and use it to help our struggling NHS
attributes.background:
Our £13 Billion Aid budget needs to be cut for our struggling NHS. 
The NHS are struggling for staff, beds and resources to keep up with the growing demand. The NHS needs to be updated; with up to date systems/policies. 
Funding needs to be put into education, new staff and a important pay rise.
attributes.additional_details:
References- 

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/07/17/government-departments-struggling-spend-foreign-aid-budgets/amp/

attributes.action: The Government should buy Leonardo da Vinci's "Salvatore Mundi" for the nation
attributes.background: Painted by Leonardo at his best, fully authenticated, a snip at £75 million.
attributes.additional_details: If the French have " Mona Lisa", why can't we have "Salvatore Mundi"?

attributes.action: Make compassionate leave compulsory and paid
attributes.background: Make compassionate leave for close family members (parents, children, siblings, partners, in-laws and grandparents) compulsory for companies to recognize, and for the leave to be paid so the surviving family member is not left shortpaid due to the relatives death.
attributes.additional_details:
In May 2017, both of my grandfathers passed away. My company did not grant compassionate leave either time, giving me the only option to take it as unpaid sick leave. This pushed me into financial difficulty which I have yet to come out of, playing catch up each month. 

My cousin had the same situation, having to take annual leave on the day of our grandfathers death.

Family members dying is hard enough to deal with emotionally, the worker should not be affected financially as well.

attributes.action: Give Retained Firefighters the right to leave employment to respond to 999 calls
attributes.background: Retained Firefighters make up a majority of the fire stations across Norfolk. Retained FireFighters drop their responsibilities the second their alerters alarm. Heading towards the fire station to respond to a 999 emergency.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm appealing for the rights of these firemen to be able to leave their employment to respond to life changing 999 calls . 

I aim to make it a law that employers have to allow retained Firefighters to leave their workplace to respond to these fire calls .

attributes.action: Introduce Black History to the primary curriculum.
attributes.background:
To make Black History part of the school curriculum for Primary education such as It helps to enrich the development of the spiritual, moral, social and cultural needs of all ethnic groups.

We believe Black History should be made a mandatory element of the national curriculum.

attributes.action: Introduce a tourist tax in London - similar to the likes of New York and Naples.
attributes.background: Introducing a tourist tax would increase funds available in the capital for a whole range of issues - from tackling homelessness to improving existing infrastructure.

attributes.action: Form a cross-party commission (national consensus) which negotiates Brexit
attributes.background:
I  think that the issue is too important, so we have to get it right. Such a Independent cross-party, all encapsulating approach will be formidable.
1. It will represent all of us 
2. it will show at the negotiations that; we mean Business! 
3. The whole nation will be behind it
attributes.additional_details:
When we and future generations look back at these historic times we can then at least know for sure that everyone took part and was represented in this monumental decision and effort of exiting the EU. And did it as seamlessly as possible.    

If we do not negotiate with national consensus the chances of us and the future generations resenting the actions that were taken will be inevitable.

eg. the IRAQ WAR and the Chilcott report

attributes.action: Ban all non-recycled (in UK) single use food containers and utensils.
attributes.background:
With current bio-technological alternatives to almost all disposable food container and utensil, it is unacceptable that current wasteful practices have not been eliminated from our society.

Until organisations can prove that all materials used in packaging is recycled, a total ban is required.
attributes.additional_details:
In early 2017 a petition 'Ban all non-recyclable/non-compostable packaging in the UK' was debated. Although this raised many valid and relevant points, it did not provide a clear strategy dealing with the problem. With the bio-plastic alternatives available, legislation is required to tackle this.

Although some big corporations have paid lip service to sustainability (E.G. In store coffee cup recycling schemes), the impact will alway be superficial.

Please read the original debate responses.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to label non-racist people as racist.
attributes.background: I am tired of non-racist people being called racist and groups against terrorism being labelled as racist.  Racism is justifiably a serious offence and calling people racist when it's unjust and untrue should be considered just as serious an offence.

attributes.action: Make Tv licences free for students studying Media and/or television.
attributes.background: Living in London and being a student is expensive. That, combined with the low maintenance loans, budgeting is a big part of being a student. Paying £147 a year to watch television, that is involved in our study, means a lot of people don't have access to this resource due to their budget.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of media students I have spoken to have also gone without a television licence which has affected their study. However, students are not willing to break the law and pay the £1000 fine, just to help improve their research and their grade.

attributes.action: Create a new public holiday for Indian new year's day
attributes.background: Show the British people that Government policies are truly representative of the the cultural diversity across our society. Diwali and Indian New Year mark an important time of the year for many different groups and we should mark this occasion with a public holiday.

attributes.action: Parents/carers of bullies should face jail time and/or a fine.
attributes.background: Children's suicide levels in the UK are on the rise and this is a direct result from being bullied. Bullying is a rampant problem in schools all across the UK, parents/carers need to take more responsibility for the actions of those in their care.
attributes.additional_details: In certain towns such as North Tonawand, New York have introduced laws where parents of bullies face a potential 15 days in prison or a $250 (£190) fine. The UK needs to follow suit in an attempt to resolve the ongoing problem that is bullying.

attributes.action: Provide better mental health services for 17 year olds
attributes.background: At the age of 17 it's one of the most stressful periods of your life and yet there is no support out there for those who have mental health difficulties unless you're already in the system
attributes.additional_details: CAMHS is for children and adolescents; IAPT is for 18 and over year olds. At 17, CAMHS say that you're too old to be in their care and IAPT says you're too young! So there needs to be a better system which provides for 17 year olds in the transition period to being an adult.

attributes.action: The council  to provide 24/7 childcare service to enable anyone access to work.
attributes.background: I am a single parent trying to do evening classes and work, however I am finding it impossible to access registered childcare after 6pm or weekends.  I have spoken with the head teachers in schools and they also agree that they all have many parents who don't have support,  nurses, or shift-workers.
attributes.additional_details:
Childcare could be provided by the council 24/7 and staff located in any area.  This means people can work in extended jobs and is important in many sectors of work.  The private childcare arrangements is not supportive and last minute emergencies is unobtainable. 
If the council provided help with limit of children and let the establishment grow then it will provide more work to qualified childcare support and enable parents to work and not be discriminated against as currently they are.

attributes.action: Zero Rate all School Uniform for VAT regardless of size.
attributes.background: Children’s clothing is zero rated for VAT depending on size. But, larger school uniform is zero rated for children under 14 if it is unique to a school. No child can leave school before age 16, so this is unfair.  All customized school uniform, should be zero-rated, regardless of age.

attributes.action: scrap 'smart' motorways and revert to a hard shoulder
attributes.background: So called 'smart' motorways are anything but smart . A small refuge that can barely accommodate an HGV . Cars do not breakdown always where there is a refuge available . There is no facility for cars/lorries to re-join at motorway speed . Cars breaking down in the 4th lane are sitting ducks .

attributes.action: Scrap credit card age verification on pornographic sites
attributes.background: The approach to the UK Digital Economy Act Section 3 on Online Pornography which requires every pornographic site to have age verification by holding credit card information of users is completely misguided and shows ministers have a complete lack of understanding of how the internet works.
attributes.additional_details: This will lead to porn companies storing vast amounts of credit card information which could easily be subject to hacking. Porn sites wont necessarily have the proper security. VPN, Tor Browser, proxy search or a torrent make age verification pointless with easy work arounds. Tor Browsers could lead to young people accessing content that is banned/illegal in the UK such as rape & child pornography videos on the dark web. Fraudulent porn sites could also potentially steal credit card information.

attributes.action: To not spend £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust
attributes.background:
Why are we spending £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust? Great Britain didn't carry out this atrocity but spent years fighting at war because of it. 
Surely this is tribute enough? 
Spend our money on more pressing matters at home , e.g.  NHS etc.

attributes.action: Make teaching about tax and local politics compulsory in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Many people when they leave secondary school and college are thrown into the deep end of life and know nothing about the world they are entering into causing them to end up in debt or not even know how to pay bills.

attributes.action: Require shop signs to be turned off overnight to reduce light pollution
attributes.background: The UK Government and Parliament should change the law to require illuminated business signs to be switched off at night to reduce light pollution in towns & cities.
attributes.additional_details: LB Merton has, at great expense, replaced street lights to help reduce the amount of light pollution in the area. Their efforts are wasted because of a huge Sainsbury’s sign nearby which remains lit throughout the night. The M&S sign, on the same building, is on a timer and turned off between 11-6.

attributes.action: Make spent conviction dismissals a protected right for -2 years in employment
attributes.background: Having recently been dismissed for having a spent conviction despite the protection under the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1979. Under employment law this action is unlawful and would lead to an automatic unfair dismissal if an individual has 2 years service. This action is discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Sec 4 of the rehabilitation of offenders act 1979 makes it unlawful to be sacked simply for not disclosing a spent conviction, yet there is no penalty or recourse for the rehabilitated person to take action against this form of discrimination!  
As this is already listed as an automatic unfair dismissal, then it should be looked at to decrease the requirement of 2 years service and treat it the same as the other protected reasons such as whistleblowing, discrimination etc.

attributes.action: Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016
attributes.background:
This act made the sale, distribution, and consumption of all psychoactive substances (with the exceptions of food, tobacco, alcohol, caffeine and poppers) illegal.
This a ridiculous piece of legislation that in no way serves public health or even law and order, and is in effect a ban on fun.
attributes.additional_details:
This legislation puts people at risk by sending these substances into the hands of criminal gangs. It also criminalises harmless drug users, putting them into contact with more dangerous offenders in prison, and increasing the already dangerously high prison population.
An evidence-based drugs policy will allow for properly safe, regulated use, and allow people who might have problems with these drugs to feel safe getting help. This law is a waste of police resources and an affront to freedom.

attributes.action: Cap Insurance Prices For People Under 25.
attributes.background: Insurance prices for young drivers is too high, often being in the thousands for a car that will only cost a few hundred pounds. Similar petitions have been started in the past but this one is different as I propose that a power cap is put on cars.
attributes.additional_details: My idea is to introduce a similar system to motorcycles and limit the power of cars young people can drive for 3 years after passing their test. A limit of 1600cc, this lowers the power that a young driver can have therefore meaning that they cannot have a car that is too powerful for them to control, insurance companies can then cap out insurance making it lower for all people as there are less powerful cars being driven by young drivers, making the roads safer for everyone in turn too.

attributes.action: The Houses of Parliament should erect a monument to Daniel O'Connell
attributes.background: Daniel O'Connell, often known as The Liberator or The Great Emancipator, was an Irish political leader. He campaigned, successfully, for Catholic Emancipation in the first half of the 19th century.
attributes.additional_details: O'Connell played a leading role in achieving Catholic Emancipation - including the right for Catholics to sit in the Westminster Parliament - and the values of egalitarianism, tolerance and human rights, which he helped instil, continue to underpin modern democracy around the world. A leading MP from 1828-1841, his philosophy and career inspired diverse others from Mahatma Gandhi to Martin Luther King Jr. to Nelson Mandela. It is time for O'Connell to be recognised with a monument in Parliament.

attributes.action: Call on Boris Johnson to apologise immediately to Libya
attributes.background: Boris Johnson, the UK’s foreign secretary, is yet again finding himself in troubled water after making arguably racist remarks about another country. The fact that a foreign secretary can do this is baffling. He must apologise immediately - his views are NOT echoed by the UK people.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.com/news/amp/uk-politics-41490174

attributes.action: Calculate student maintenance loans in a fairer way
attributes.background: Student maintenance loans are calculated on a household income basis. This method is not Fair as parents are expected to make up the rest but can’t with a bigger family. The aim of this is to have the loans be calculated by disposable income per person in the household rather than the overall income
attributes.additional_details: Maintenance loans are currently calculated by household income rather than disposable income per person, meaning that some students may get the same maintenance loan despite their parents being able to assist them more financially, as parents are expected to make up what we don’t get of the loan. This means an only child will have more support than someone with 3 younger siblings because their parents earn the same amount which isn’t fair as one family is more able to provide support
